mhs.src.storage.persistence.remote

Class GoogleCalendarMhs

  • java.lang.Object
    • mhs.src.storage.persistence.remote.GoogleCalendarMhs

  • public class GoogleCalendarMhs
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides an interface between MHS tasks and GoogleCalendar Supported functionality: 1) Create event entry 2) Retrieve event entry(s) 3) Update event entry 4) delete event entry(s) This class is also used to handle two calendars: user's default calendar and a second calendar with title "Completed Tasks (MHS)" When a task is done, it is moved to the second calendar To use the above services: 1) retrieve access token with user's email and password 2) create an instance of this class with retrieved access token
    Author:
    John Wong

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GoogleCalendarMhs(java.lang.String appName, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String accessToken) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CalendarEventEntry createEvent(Task newTask)
      creates an event in user's default calendar, if the task is already done event is created in user's completed tasks calendar instead
      void deleteEvent(java.lang.String eventId)
      deletes event in default calendar or task calendar depending on which calendar the task is in
      void deleteEvents(java.lang.String startTime, java.lang.String endTime)
      deletes all events within the specified time range
      boolean isDeleted(CalendarEventEntry calendarEvent)
      checks if an event has been marked as deleted
      boolean isEventCompleted(CalendarEventEntry calendarEvent)
      checks if an event is in the completed tasks calendar
      CalendarEventEntry retrieveEvent(java.lang.String eventId)
      checks default and completed task calendar for event and returns it if found
      java.util.List<CalendarEventEntry> retrieveEvents(java.lang.String startTime, java.lang.String endTime)
      retrieve events falling within the specified start and end time, deleted events are returned as well
      static java.lang.String retrieveUserToken(java.lang.String appName, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password)
      Retrieves the Google Calendar access token using user's email and password
      CalendarEventEntry updateEvent(Task updatedTask)
      update an event with existing task ID to new title, start time, end time updates the event's calendar depending on whether it is completed or not
